value.text: EMMA Foundation Goals and Mission Statements
A roadmap to elevate the top 1% and better, blending intellect, ethics, resilience, and compassion for meaningful impact.
EMMA empowers people to reach their fullest potential through the 8 Pistons of Life while pairing soul (mind) development with practical support.

items.title: 1) The 8 Pistons of Life
items.body: EMMA is a US-based IRS 501(c)(3) global philanthropic entity that helps people reach their maximum potential via the Founder's 8 Pistons named after Greek gods and goddesses: Health (Hygieia), Wealth (Plutus), Intellect (Athena), Family (Philotas), Travel (Hermes), Philosophy (Dike), Self-Mastery (Sophrosyne), and Philanthropy (Eleos).

items.title: 2) Teaching people how to think
items.body: The goal is to foster rational, logical, just, and impartial thought based on science and reason. Practice turns conclusions into habits, revealing the real magic.

items.title: 3) Seven tiers of daily practice
items.body: EMMA provides seven tiers of non-denominational services and encourages a balanced life that blends wealth, health, spirituality, enlightenment, eudaemonic, ascetic, stoic, and balanced-epicurean elements, with diet, exercise, self-mastery, and meditation.

items.title: 4) Clearer thinking to solve problems
items.body: To fix material and spiritual issues, EMMA replaces flawed ideas with logical, science-based concepts, using the 7 Commandments of the 21st Century Science.

items.title: 5) Feeding the soul as well as the body
items.body: Beyond food and shelter, EMMA nurtures the mind that discerns truth from falsehood, allocating more resources to elevate consciousness while still providing material aid.

items.title: 6) Clarity amid misinformation
items.body: Recent election cycles, global conflicts, pandemics, and big-tech power have exposed corruption across institutions, eroding trust and highlighting the need for personal discernment.

items.title: 7) Empowering individuals first
items.body: EMMA believes governments, corporations, media, and conventional education will not fully serve ordinary people; change must be driven by individuals helping each other reach their highest potential.

items.title: 8) Self-reliance and resilience
items.body: EMMA discourages entitlement mindsets and instead promotes self-reliance, responsibility, hard work, and charity for the unfortunate while building strength on your own merit.

items.title: 9) A grassroots, bottom-up movement
items.body: By empowering individuals and fostering collaboration, EMMA aims to create ripple effects that improve the world through the 7-tier system and trickle-down impact.

items.title: 10) Test your thinking
items.body: Challenge your biases and reasoning via The 1% and Better - 8 Clubs, P3: Intellect - 8PQ Athena, and read chapter 1 of the Book of Intense Truth.

items.title: 11) Rewiring the mind
items.body: Harness the prefrontal cortex (System 2, the rider) to guide System 1 (the elephant), overcoming cognitive dissonance and unhelpful habits with science, reason, and truth.

items.title: Appeal to emotion with compassion and truth
items.body: Create a warm environment while teaching the bitter truth, honest self-analysis, and rational life review to reconfigure the prefrontal cortex (System 2).

items.title: Daily practice and re-patterning
items.body: Provide a friendly space for rituals, meditation, and stoic practice so System 1 is gradually aligned with well-thought-out ideas.

items.title: Local chapters
items.body: EMMAM will be allowed to open local EMMA chapters with guidance from the foundation.

items.title: Public discourse
items.body: EMMAM and other professionals will be interviewed for EMMA's YouTube channel to educate the public.

items.title: Train the elephant
items.body: System 1 is 84% of the brain and holds untapped power; EMMA trains members to influence it and align passion with EMMA's value system.

items.title: Learn from thinkers
items.body: System 1 and 2 were described by Nobel Laureate Daniel Kahneman in Thinking, Fast and Slow.

items.title: Track and refine progress
items.body: Members monitor their progress and fine-tune personalized strategies for success.

items.title: Commit for life
items.body: Members (EMMAM) commit for life, take an oath to help others for life, and operate openly regardless of race, sex, religion, or origin.

items.title: Entrepreneurship and investment
items.body: Entrepreneurs can build their own ideas or join EMMA initiatives; investors can join the CLAP club and Plutus Investment to connect with founders and angel investors.

items.title: Why people fall short
items.body: Common blockers include self-deception and lies; wanting things for free and now; tunnel vision; lack of critical thinking and logic; and poor emotional control.

items.title: Invitation to driven talent
items.body: Professors, graduate and Ph.D. students, and professionals anywhere in the world can join, contribute brain, time, and skill, and earn sweat equity in EMMA-sponsored startups.

items.title: Snowball effect
items.body: Small actions compound. The Ice Bucket Challenge showed how a simple idea can go global and fund real change.

items.title: Survival for the most adaptable
items.body: Adapt to thrive. Netflix evolved from DVDs to streaming, proving flexibility wins in changing environments.

items.title: Pareto's law
items.body: Roughly 80% of outcomes come from 20% of inputs. Focus effort where it creates outsized results.

items.title: Price's law
items.body: The square root of the number of people in a domain creates half the output. A small group can move the needle for millions.

items.title: Proximity matters
items.body: You become the average of the five people you spend time with. Curate circles that push you higher.

items.title: Lessons from history
items.body: Scarcity and abundance follow those who build capability; purpose and rigor compound over time.

items: Matthew 25:29 (NIV): For whoever has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.
Mark 4:25 (NIV): Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.
Luke 8:18 (NIV): Therefore, consider carefully how you listen. Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they think they have will be taken from them.

items.title: Self-awareness with honesty
items.body: Most people desire wealth without admitting it; EMMA pairs thoughtful charity with a venue to build value and help others.

items.title: Survival and group uplift
items.body: Nature favors groups that cooperate. EMMA enhances group survival for self-interest through intelligence and collaboration.

items.title: Positive-sum mindset
items.body: In positive-sum games, nice people can finish first. Reputation, cooperation, and creating new value matter most.

items.title: Emergent possibilities
items.body: Consciousness, fairness, and shared purpose can shift outcomes. Feeding both the body and the mind is required.

items.title: Join and grow
items.body: EMMA seeks volunteers and builders who want meaning, excellence, and the chance to create outsized, positive change.
